content: quote: www.youtube.com/watch?v=te-cKxsBapM I try to post it about every three months. I saw it the first time, about two years ago. Every time I watch it I cry. A listening ear, a caring heart, an open mind and an extend hand may be all I can offer, but they are yours without charge or judgment.

content: Lonestar's, "I'm Already There, Tribute to the Troops" got my waterworks going the first time I watched it and my son (Marine) hasn't even been deployed yet. youtube.com/watch?v=nrgwxLff4Io Another "lump in throat" video that many know by now.... Big and Rich "The 8th of November" in tribute to the Vietnam troops, specifically the 173rd Airborne Brigade. youtube.com/watch?v=SfElHIt7n0s&feature=PlayList&p=731B71DCACC1E883&playnext=1&index=6 FYI: during that 8th of November video, the grey haired guy putting on his suit...that's not an actor, that's Niles Harris, the veteran they are singing about. I first saw Big and Rich sing this song with Niles sitting there, all on the Don Imus Show back when it was on MSNBC. Don
